meanings.definition: To bring back into a group or organization after a period of absence.
meanings.sent1: After being away for a year, the company is reinducting me into the team.
meanings.sent2: The school is reinducting the student who was on a long medical leave.
meanings.sent3: The club is reinducting the old members with a fun welcome party.
meanings.sent4: Reinducting the experienced staff felt like reassembling a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The process of reinducting the volunteers was smooth and efficient.

meanings.definition: To reintroduce or reinstate someone into a position or role.
meanings.sent1: The manager is reinducting the employee who was on extended leave.
meanings.sent2: The coach is reinducting the player back into the starting lineup.
meanings.sent3: Reinducting the actor into the play added a surprising twist to the storyline.
meanings.sent4: Reinducting the captain into the team injected new energy into the game.
meanings.sent5: The teacher is reinducting the student council members for the upcoming event.
